org.ecoinformatics.seek.querybuilder

Class QBSplitPaneStandard

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • org.ecoinformatics.seek.querybuilder.QBSplitPaneStandard
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.event.ListSelectionListener, QBBuilderInterface

    public class QBSplitPaneStandard
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements javax.swing.event.ListSelectionListener, QBBuilderInterface
    This class shows a split view with a set of table schemas showing via tabs in the upper pane. And a two tab control in the lower pane. The Select pane enables the user to indicate which fields will be displayed and what the conditions will be for each of the fields. The Where pane enables
    Author:
    Rod Spears
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • canConvertTo

        public boolean canConvertTo(QBBuilderInterface aBldr)
        This checks to see if this type of builder can convert the internal SQL to a more complex or less complex form. This is typically called when switching from a more complex builder to a less complex builder
        Specified by:
        canConvertTo in interface QBBuilderInterface
        Parameters:
        aBldr - The "receiving" builder, in other words can this builder convert the SQL to the new builder
        Returns:
        true if it can convert it, false if it can not
